website_summaries.verdict: A large tackle bag that will keep all of your equipment organized and within easy reach.
pros: Multiple storage compartments help keep you organized
cons: The material is lightweight, but some have said it doesn't hold up well over the long term

customer_reviews.title: An excellent fishing accessory
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this fishing bag to replace my 3 tray tackle box. I have to say that this was an excellent upgrade. The bag is very spacious and comes with dividers to separate items. It can easily accommodate 4 Plano boxes while still having room for extra storage. it includes a pouch on the front for additional storage along with a place to keep your fishing license. Most importantly, it is lightweight and easy to carry over your shoulder. It is a great addition for the fisherman who wants to carry as much a possible while still keeping their hands free.
customer_reviews.author: A random nickname

customer_reviews.title: but after comparing it to some of my friends bags and my older bags I am very satisfied. For the price you can't beat it
customer_reviews.text: At first I was a bit skeptical on the bag, but after comparing it to some of my friends bags and my older bags I am very satisfied. For the price you can't beat it. Plenty of storage room and options with the included dividers. Had it out once where it rained on us most of the day and the bag held up very well in the weather. I especially am pleased with the undercoating on the bottom of the bag that generally is seen on more expensive bags. Only have owned it for about 5 months, however its seen heavy use this season and I have not witnessed anything fall apart just yet.
customer_reviews.author: AP_WV

customer_reviews.title: Bag is perfection for fishing
customer_reviews.text: This bag is nice. Has a lot of pockets and components for all of your fishing supplies. I like the removable dividers for the main compartment so that you can make whatever pockets you need to in the main compartment or you can just have one huge open space if you prefer. The pockets on the sides are great as well. The shoulder strap is comfortable and comes in handy for freeing up your hands for your poles, net, bait or whatever else you may have. If you're a true fisherman and trying to get out of toting the traditional hard shell tackle box, this is for you!
customer_reviews.author: Sherman RobinsonTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his birthday a few years ago, and wanted to wait to review it until he'd used it a lot. He goes fishing a lot. I mean, a couple times a week for a few hours each time. So far, this bag looks the same as when I bought it and has held up through boat trips, being laid on the ground, kicked, dropped, etc. and it still looks the same. It's not discolored from anything being spilled on it, doesn't stink and the bottom still looks good. There are so many pockets that he hasn't even filled them all yet. This feels so much better to carry than a hard tackle box.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, tassels fall apart almost immediately and the stitching comes apart as well.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item a long time ago and am just now finding the time to leave reviews for multiple historic purchases. Unfortunately, every. single. tassle. on. every. single. zipper ripped off within 1-3 times of use. The stitching has also started to come apart on certain parts of the bag as well. Albeit, the price is low, you get what you pay for. I would suggest you buy anything other than this unless you plan on putting something in it and leaving in a closet for 100 years. If you plan on using in ANY field, don't expect it to work the way it was intended on.
customer_reviews.author: PhunGuy

customer_reviews.title: Survival kit
customer_reviews.text: We have a basic first aid kit (Plano 23600-01 Stowaway with burn cream, gloves, tweezers, etc.), large roll of duct tape, Swedish FireSteel flint, bag of magnesium shavings, skin stapler, battle bandages (2), rubbing alcohol, instant ice packs (2), USMC survival guide, fishing line, pocket knives (2), 100yd 1/4" para-cord, mylar blankets (4), med. jar peanut butter, canned chicken (2), SAM splint, lg. gauze pads (4), survival stove with 24 solid fuel tabs, camp pot/cup, and spare socks & undies for my husband and I all in this bag. Oh, and some ammo and a Gurkha knife. I know I'm leaving a few little things out. Pretty much tells you that, with the right organization, this bag holds plenty.
customer_reviews.author: R Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Bag
customer_reviews.text: Through two seasons and the bag is in great shape. I mostly fish out of a Kayak and this bag is perfect for my needs. The bag has several interior dividers that can be positioned however you want your bag designed. I use two 11" Plano boxes and keep the middle divided into sections that accommodate other fishing gear like a scale, bobbers, and split shot. I could add another 11" Plano box if I wanted instead of the middle section being open for miscellaneous gear. I really like having the pockets on the outside available for sunscreen, bug spray, etc. There is a mesh drink holder that works great. I would recommend this to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kirby

customer_reviews.title: Rusted after one week of freshwater fishing
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bag, used it on one weeklong freshwater fishing trip and promptly returned it. After being exposed to normal amounts of water (in a boat, on a lake) for less than a week many of the metal components (eyelets, etc) began rusting. This rust then rubbed off on things in the bag, staining them. Everyone else loves this bag - did I get a defect? I am primarily a saltwater fisherman but after this rusted in freshwater exposure alone I would not use it in any environment.
customer_reviews.author: BruKraft

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as a Christmas present for my daughter's boyfriend. It is excellent quality with thick, tough sides and the ability to move the interior "walls" to make different sized and shaped compartments. In addition, it has lots of exterior storage space for various tools, lures and other gear. The only reason I didn't give it five stars is that he hasn't used it yet, so I can't testify to its durability. However, it feels very solid and I imagine it will hold up well to years of use.
customer_reviews.author: wsk

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag for its small size
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent bag, but not really big enough except for the smallest of day trips. After this I will only use backpacks for my fishing tackle as I usually hike in a ways to where ever I am going. Not that this is a bad bag at all, just... bags like this have very limited uses and I wouldn't recommend it to most. I just have a lot of stuff so I can make a little couple hour tackle box out of this.
customer_reviews.author: Nixon Percutio

customer_reviews.title: Good design, but poorly made
customer_reviews.text: I made this purchase to take on my kayak fishing trips based on many positive reviews. I will give it more than 1 star because it is very well designed and would be an excellent bag if they could have used zippers that would last more than a few trips. By the 4th or 5th trip, all zippers were broken. I guess I will see if they can replace it, but not sure what to do with another unless they fix the junky zippers. I have gone back to using a backpack since I don't want to spend over $100 for a fishing bag that will stand up to 5-10 fishing trips per month.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag. Comes with 2 full width dividers and ...
customer_reviews.text: For about $30! Awesome bag. Comes with 2 full width dividers and 3 smaller dividers with velco for individual adjustment, nice shoulder or waist strap, great pockets, includes mini karabiers at front. Perfect for day use to hold multiple items and a snack. Well made and had top cross bungees to hold small clothing. Yes, really like this bag!
customer_reviews.author: max

customer_reviews.title: Ruggedly Constructed, Comfortable to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this soft bag for my son as he fishes with a baitcaste and I use a fly rod. I own a similar Plano bag as well as the appropriate Plano tackle box. This will allow us to load the tackle box as needed then each withdraw the appropriate Plano boxes for our own type of fishing. The construction is rugged yet comfortable. There's more than plenty room inside the bag. Again it will be easy to load and unload uaing the Plano tackle box for a "bank".
customer_reviews.author: By CJs Pirate

customer_reviews.title: Excellent price for what it is.
customer_reviews.text: Can't complain to much. For a soft sided fishing bag it's awesome. The underside is very well built and the waterproof compartment is nice. Rivals those bags worth $60 or more roughly for the accessories it has. My only problem is after about 2 months of regular use to average about 2X a week. The outside compartment zipper broke. Everything else is functional. Hopefully the main compartment stays as is. All in all for $20 you can;t beat it. Even though my zipper seemed cheap and ineffective after awhile. I'd buy another one hands down for the price. There are far to many pros for the zipper con to outweigh it.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Krekeler

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bags I have purchased
customer_reviews.text: This is a bag that I can tell I will have for a very long time. The picture doesn't describe the quality of this item. The construction is so sturdy that it rivals bags at a higher price point. I love the amount of pockets, and the main compartment is perfect for what I need. I surf cast, and so a light bag that I could sling over my shoulder was required, and this bag hit the mark perfectly. Only reason for 4 stars was that I know there are better bags out there, but they are at a higher price. This bag will take time before it's replaced. I may even purchase a second one to use for storage.
customer_reviews.author: James The Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice pocket placements and all but after only a couple ...
customer_reviews.text: Very Spacious bag. Really nice pocket placements and all but after only a couple uses, most of the laces that hold the zippers completely fell off. The areas where the bag is held(holders/strap) is all ripped up not being able to hold up 3-8lbs.(Only have lures and tackles in there with boxes) Very good at first but only lasts like give or take 1 to 2 weeks before everything starts breaking apart. Like i said earlier, i've used this probably once or twice a week for 3 weeks
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: but the bag is made good and plenty of space and pockets for everything you ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not actually had the chance to take this out fishing since we are still waiting on some ice here in MN, but the bag is made good and plenty of space and pockets for everything you could need, it fits 4 boxes nicely in the main area and has plenty of pockets for all the other little things. Will update this review later if needed, but i'm thinking this bag will hold up pretty well.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Best fishing bag yet. We originally got this to take kayak fishing but now use it all the time. It's probably the best fishing tackle container I've ever used. If it gets fishy, which happens since we take it fishing, we just throw it in the wash and bam! The fish are gone. We have been using the little clear snap shut plastic boxes similar to those that Amazon recommends. They work really great. Takes a lot of the hastle out of getting ready to go fishing. Now my husband and I are always ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Mine didn't hold up real well in saltwater environment. ...
customer_reviews.text: Mine didn't hold up real well in saltwater environment. Could have been My fault. Maybe i needed to fresh water hose off more often Maybe not so much of my riggs in the bag./ I still have have it, The bag ripped along zipper seam. Samhane11 / Four brothers Journey
customer_reviews.author: Four Brothers Journey

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome tackle bag for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome tackle bag for the money. I can fit a lot in there and has plenty of pockets for storage. I took out the inside dividers because the just seemed to keep getting in the way and the velcro doesn't seem to hold them exactly in place. I didn't let that effect my star rating though. Easier to carry around than a tackle box of the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M Fringer

customer_reviews.title: The bad first: I ordered two of these
customer_reviews.text: The bad first: I ordered two of these, one came sealed in plastic but one was already open and that one was missing the two carabiners. A bit disappointing. The good: fanatic product. Well built, sturdy and looks great. I bought these for my father and father in law , they will hey plenty of use. Just wish they both came with the carabiners. Otherwise I would give five stars.
customer_reviews.author: ghrgneex

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...Not great
customer_reviews.text: Bags pretty big, I can fit three plano lure boxes in it along with a stringer and ton of gear//plastics. Been in use for about 2 years now and yes the zippers and the strings attached to them are badly made. I replaced all strings connecting the zippers so you can open the box, if not the bag would be useless. With a little bit of Macgyer action done to it, its a decent beginners bag. I came from a huge tackle box, to this bag, and after 2 years Im ready to upgrade. You get what you pay for, but overall worth the $20 it will last 2 maybe 3 years and Im a heavy fisherman.
customer_reviews.author: Locdizzle

customer_reviews.title: Man!  What a super nice bag for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Super nice bag for the money! I looked at the spider wire bags and almost bought one. I am glad I chose this. It is cheaper and nicer. Lots of compartments, the dividers inside the main compartment are fully adjustable, quality straps and handles, heavy duty zippers, easy to clean out, tough heavy duty fabric, and plenty of storage. This is by far the best bag I found that is high quality and inexpensive. Just a super great bargain!! Enjoy it!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for any fishing kit
customer_reviews.text: We needed a fishing kit at my parents beach house. This bag worked great and holds everything we need for our kids to get a little fishing time in. The bag is well constructed, has lots of pockets, and was really easy to use. I like it better than a typical tackle box since those can easily get knocked over when it is fully open. This bag doesn't have that problem. It is probably good to have lots of small boxes inside this bag as you don't want to just throw hooks into it without something to protect the bag and prevent tangles.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Overall it's OK. Should last couple of years with moderate use. -Quality is OK. Parts started coming apart here and there. Cheap material. -Size is on the small side. Wish it was about 30% larger. -Lots of pockets. -Well thought out design. I wouldn't change the design. If it were a little bigger and better construction and quality, I would pay twice the cost and give it 5 stars. Would I buy it again? No. I will pay more and get better quality one (and bigger).
customer_reviews.author: M.C.

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad bag. I'm using it as a small gear ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad bag. I'm using it as a small gear bag for being in a boat. My only real complaint is that zipper pulls have pulls out. They are easily repaired and can be improved upon with a little short glue. Also a bigger strip of Velcro on the right side line holder pocket would be of better use. As is the Velcro is seen to low into the closing tab preventing the pocket from fully closing. I treated my bag with a ptfe water repellant and the bag has a hard plastic bottom so that is good
customer_reviews.author: tyler g Barrus

customer_reviews.title: Great for motorcycle...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year or so and it still is main tackle "box"! It's sturdy so I put this on the back of my bike and travel to a lake with everything I need. It has a lot of little spaces "some are clear" for small boxes like hooks and sinkers. I put 2 (retractable) poles through the bands on top and tighten. Works like a charm! Unstrap, grab, put on shoulder and hike to the fishing hole. Also nice shoulder pad and looks good....being a woman this is important too. Love it!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: AdidasGirl

customer_reviews.title: had to get a bigger tackle bag..
customer_reviews.text: ...and this is the one I bought and it is worth it. many pockets to put stuff in and you can add extra plastic lure boxes. I can stuff many bags of plastic baits into it and my thermometer, license, hook sharpener etc can be put into one of the zip up pockets and you do not have to worry about them falling out. I fish from the riverbanks and this bag holds all I need and there is room for a water to drink and camera or handy cam. tight lines.
customer_reviews.author: TomWV

customer_reviews.title: Murse.
customer_reviews.text: I use this as my lunch bag / hand tools and jeez, lets face it, a purse. Aspirin, nail clippers, Leatherman, Magnifying glass, (yes, I am OAF) cigarettes lighters, phone chargers, phone. It's a Purse, deal with it. And no one thinks twice about it. Believe me, the guys I work with would be all over it, but no one gives it a thought.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Ward

customer_reviews.title: One tough BAG!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have treated this bag like a red-headed step child for the last six weeks and it has taken everything I've thrown at it and survived. I've had it out in the rain,dragged it through the sand,basically I've tried to ruin it and it has survived. The zippers still work perfect,the shoulder strap hasn't torn off and it still looks sort of new. I've been out fishing approximately 20 times with this bag,all of it surf fishing and it has stood up fantastic. BUY THIS BAG!!!! I guarantee you'll buy another one for a family member or a buddy of yours
customer_reviews.author: W. Marcum

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Love the bag... Couldn't be happier. The quality is excellent for the price. Would've been nice to have a pocket on top of the main flap instead of bungee system but that's the only complaint I have about it. It's still a great bag and can't wait to get my stowaways for it which will be here in a few days to finish off the bag. Great look and comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.author: justin billing

customer_reviews.title: Nice Bag
customer_reviews.text: I like the bag just fine. It is as sturdy as anything else is nowadays. There was a review here about zippers busting out and such and I find that highly unlikely unless it was over-packed with things. I have a Lot of stuff in mine so I can't imagine what that dude was trying to shove into his. I would give it 5 stars but the "Ready 2 Fish" is just not true. While the details tell you it is just a bag and no tackle is included, saying it is ready to fish is just false advertisement.
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bag
customer_reviews.text: I needed a medium size tackle bag for kayak fishing where space is at a premium, but you still need to have everything with you that you could possibly need. Numerous zippered pockets and adjustable dividers make it easy to keep a wide variety of items well organized. Comfortably hold 6 tackle trays in the main compartment if you need that many. It's light weigh and has a waterproof bottom so it's the perfect bag for shore fishing or fishing from a small boat or kayak.
customer_reviews.author: Peffinger

customer_reviews.title: great VALUE
customer_reviews.text: absolutely fantastic for the price! zippers are gonna go first ..... but, hey, this thing is so value priced, be happy with the 5 or 6 years of heavy use that you will probably get out of it. the design is terrific; very adaptable to your needs -- I went to the BIG BOX store and picked up some plastic boxes that fit the large compartment. I am a happy fly-fisher.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Bona

customer_reviews.title: Awesome soft side tackle bag
customer_reviews.text: Awesome soft side tackle bag. I actually got this for a dear ole Friend of mine who had been wanting a soft side bag. When I seen it for the first time with him, I almost asked him how did he like MY new bag, and kept it for myself lol. But I didn't, and like a good neighbor passed the goodness on. HE loved the bag, has plenty storage, and cool attachment points. Construction was nice, appeared to be very durable, and should last for a very long time!
customer_reviews.author: John L Gulledge

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of surf fishing. This bag is the perfect alternative to those expensive beach carts. The shoulder strap allows you to have two free hands. The criss-cross bungee cords on top of the bag allow you to secure items such as your sand spike or fishing rod to the bag for transport. Plenty of storage as well. If you don't need the shoulder strap, they are detachable and you can carry the bag with the handles. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: F Cip

customer_reviews.title: good bag for a fair price
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought it due to all the positive reviews and I am not disapointed, its bigger than I thought and has so many useful pockets. the materials are OK. It is more comfortable than a hard plastic tackle box since you can either carry it with your hand or hang it on your shoulder. And the fact that you can decide the shape of the internal space with all the little "walls" adds something unique to it,
customer_reviews.author: Martín

customer_reviews.title: Small but potent.
customer_reviews.text: At first it seemed smaller than I expected but, it turned out to be perfect. It holds all the stuff that I used to put in an old knapsack and I am now more organized when I get to the river. And surprisingly, I use the outside/top bunjie thing a lot for stuffing in a Buff or a hat or gloves a lot. Nice bag and ideal for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: R. Salcedo

customer_reviews.title: Good bag
customer_reviews.text: Good bag. Lots of storage and compartments. Looks fairly well made, but I will be returning. It comes with no hard case compartments, and to buy the 4 smaller (9" or so) ones I'd need, it would cost over $20 more. That would raise the actual price to well over $40. Much nicer, bigger bags w/ compartment to be had for that price point. I went later and bought same size as this (w/compartments) for the same price at a sporting good store. Good bag if it had the hard cases
customer_reviews.author: Paul Cavenaugh

customer_reviews.title: Valued for money - a really neat tackle bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is already my second purchase after I gave the first one to a friend who love it to bits: definitely recommended. Good size to hold most stuffs for a day of fishing (luring or surfcast, not boat fishing). Rainproof/splashproof (do not submerge) as mentioned. Really well made - good zippers, good positioned pockets, removable shoulder straps. Really appreciate the additional mesh pockets for grippers and bottled drinks.
customer_reviews.author: Huijie

customer_reviews.title: A good buy, very nice
customer_reviews.text: Ordered as a birthday gift for my son. He has always used the traditional hard tackle box and although he has a boat he does a lot of bank fishing. He likes this because the shoulder strap frees up a hand for carrying other fishing gear. He says it holds a lot more tackle than he thought it would with room to spare. A good buy, very nice. Made of quality material and well manufactured.
customer_reviews.author: Blackberry mom

customer_reviews.title: Was great to start out with
customer_reviews.text: Was great to start out with, decent size, not too big not too small but it is very weak. I fish about once a week sometimes less. Usually from the bank where I have to carry my bag and a couple of rods around, after carrying this bag around with only three 3600 boxes, the zipper no longer works on the right side of the main compartment, the zipper on the left side pocket also fails to zip in the middle. The bag simply doesn't last under light use, I've now owned it for only 4 months and its in need of replacing.
customer_reviews.author: jkhan

customer_reviews.title: Strong, except for the shoulder strap
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well-made with tons of pockets. I actually use mine for a range bag, so I probably torture it a lot more than a fisherman would. The shoulder strap gave out on one of the side rings, but I probably had 25 pounds of bullets, pistols, and accessories in it at the time. I don't blame it for that as it wasn't designed for that purpose. Lots of compartment options, including adjustable (and removable) dividers for the main area. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: ihsan

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. Good size
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son. Good size and has lots of outside storage as well. I purchased 5 Plano 23705-00 to store tackle inside and likely won't be using the dividers. The 5 fit easily with some room inside for loose items. Could definitely get 6 inside, possibly squeeze 7. The Plano boxes are a perfect length and width, but a touch narrower/shorter would be great for tackle purposes and would allow possibly a better use of space. Maybe that's what I'll look for when I purchase one for myself!!
customer_reviews.author: Tony M

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, especially for the money.
customer_reviews.text: I looked all over for a bag that I could store most of my main gear and be able to swap out containers so I did not have to always carry all my gear at one time. This is a perfect bag if you have your lures and stuff in Plano or the like storage boxes. Now I can have all my gear on the shelf and only pack the items I need. Really good size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: ST

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice but disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this bag. I have only had this about 8 months. I only use it on the weekends about twice per month. The shoulder strap has already torn loose. Equipment needs to last longer than this!
customer_reviews.author: R. P. Majka

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for taking the essentials
customer_reviews.text: Great bag for taking the essentials. Bought some organizer boxes to go inside and there are lots of great pockets that are well laid out for fishing. Even a nice pocket and holder for a fishing license. Being a soft bag w/ a shoulder strap makes lugging my surf casting gear much easier and the waterproof bottom prevents salt water from wicking up into the bag when I set it down on damp sand.
customer_reviews.author: SealBeachcomber

customer_reviews.title: Hands free
customer_reviews.text: Now you can have a free hand when you are walking with your tackle and pole! This is a great investment for any fisher. All the compartments are well made and serve a purpose. The main pocket can fit three full size plano organizers with room for extra line or food! Also, the bungee top is great for a jacket in case you are up early or out late. This bag is so nice I have one and got one for my cousin as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Mills

customer_reviews.title: Great bag. It has a hard bottom and and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great bag. It has a hard bottom and and the internal compartments are adjustable so you can organize them however you see fit. I purchased this for my wife, who truly enjoys fishing, and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag! I had a browning from bass pro, but it was to big. I ended up selling it getting this smaller one. Easy to carry around. Im an every once in awhile fisher and this suites me perfect. I carry a case of lures and another case of hooks, weights, and such. Also have my hunting knife and gloves in there. Bobbers, yo-yos, pliers, phone, batterys and sun glasses also fit with ease. Im going to buy another one to store back incase they discontinue this model so i have it when this wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Missing Shoulder Strap
customer_reviews.text: Hi I have recently received my Ready 2 Fish Soft sided Tackle bag and really liked it but the only problem was that it was missing the shoulder strap. I went through the box several times and there was no strap. I am unsure whether I should return it or ask for a replacement strap. I would rate it higher but it didn't have the strap and that is a pretty important part. Other than that lots of space and more than enough removable dividers with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The compartments are interchangeable and it looks like a smaller duffle bag
customer_reviews.text: I used it for my son to take to college as a first aid kit. Filled it with all kinds of stuff he could use if he got sick. The compartments are interchangeable and it looks like a smaller duffle bag. It was a great hit. He didn't feel weird taking it across campus if his girlfriend was sick and needed something from it. I'll buy another one for my other son soon. P.S. - My husband, who is a fisherman, thought it would actually be a great tackle bag as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: D. Cukier

customer_reviews.title: It's like everyone who rated this bag is a fake reviewer
customer_reviews.text: This bag is a piece of $&@?. It's like everyone who rated this bag is a fake reviewer. Made with low quality nylon, stitching is total crap. Hell the bag came with the bungee already torn. Opened the bag and there's polyester threads along the insides from all corners of the terrible stitching. Velcro isn't stitched to align with each other.. The most I would pay for this is 5$ and that's so I can use it to pick up my dogs crap in the back yard. What a joke for 30$. Deserves no stars.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tang

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I am fishing as a co angler this year for Bass Fishing League, and let me say, this tackle bag is awesome! It's not too big but it's not too small. Just what I need for going light! It does not come with tackle boxes inside but I was ok with that. I think anyone who purchases this product will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Nice tackle bag! Feels a bit cheap but can't complain for the price... The picture makes it look huge like a duffle bag which it's not, but once you start loading it up it fits a lot! I fit 2 large tackle boxes, extra reel, 2 metal rod holders, scale, line with plenty of extra room for other stuff. I would recommend! Better than the backpack I was using...
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Patterson

customer_reviews.title: Good tackle bag
customer_reviews.text: It says "ready to fish" but it doesn't come preloaded with tackle.. It does however have a very good size main compartment. I took one reviewers suggestion and ordered 6 of the 5 compartment storage boxes and they stack very neatly. In my bag, I have the six storage containers stacked in two rows of three with the River Monster tackle box on top with plenty of room to stick a bag lunch on top of that! I'm very pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: not so good, poor construction
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this as my main tackle bag for a few months now. All the zippers except the main compartment have broken off and thats my biggest beef. Its has held its shape but the bag looks pretty ragged now. I will not be buying another one as a replacement
customer_reviews.author: KDubz

customer_reviews.title: Pretty much perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: For size and capability and capacity. If you need more than this to hold your gear for most any kind of fishing, you probably are doing it for a living and need to catch something with every lure your sponsors make. :) What with it holding hard Plano type cases, I can't see any reason to have a hard cased tackle box anymore, especially since you can't throw them over your shoulder like this baby.
customer_reviews.author: doogle

customer_reviews.title: Girlfriend loves it
customer_reviews.text: When I recieved my new tackle backpack my girlfriend wanted a new fishing tackle box, so this is what she picked out. I fit four Plano 23500-00 boxes in the main compartment; I could of whent larger but she likes this size, and I removed the dividers that come with this tackle bag. It is a quality made product that isn't to heavy but will hold all of her fishing needs.
customer_reviews.author: KAW999

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars
customer_reviews.text: After using the tackle bag for a month now, I've gotten to appreciate and love its design. The adjustable compartments inside give you the flexibility to have tackle cases and baits/lures containers arranged in multiple configurations to your liking. I don't really have any complains about this product whatsoever. Good buy!
customer_reviews.author: EG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I can fit four 3600 tackle boxes. has a hard bottom (plastic). Been using it on my boat for 1 year now and everything is like new. Saves a lot of space on my boat compared to those big plastic tackle boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: fishing my new bag!
customer_reviews.text: has a good space, I put in my two spinning reels, 3 boxes of lures, a spool of string parts, an essence, and there is still some space! I was fishing on a San Rafael river in Sarapiqui, Costa Rica embossed one very irregular and difficult terrain and the truth was very comfortable to transport!, the trouble is that when delivered, despite its being a new bag was a little dirty.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Freeze

customer_reviews.title: Great bag!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag!! Fits all my gear in it and then some!! Only issue I had was when I got it the water bottle strap appeared not to be sewn in and when I tried putting a can of Off in it, it came loose. I called Amazon and told them about the issue and they offered me a new bag or a discount. I took the discount since I never planned on putting a water bottle in it but use it for Off in case I run to mosquitoes.
customer_reviews.author: BigDog

customer_reviews.title: questionable construction
customer_reviews.text: This bag only gets 2 stars for a fishing tackle bag. In the driveway the bungie cord frayed off the top. Within one week most of the zipper pulls fell apart. Also the water bottle holder pocket became unusable when the top strip pulled apart and now just gets in the way. The internal storage customization is nice, and I will still use the bag. However its use is now limited to just a smallish duffle. I wouldn't trust this thing with any of my stuff on any kind of fishing adventure.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mosty

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality.  Look elsewhere for your fishing gear needs...
customer_reviews.text: Very poor quality. All of the zipper pulls have fallen off (after 2 uses). zipper quality is very poor. Feels very cheap. The layout isn't bad but is smaller than it looks in the pics.
customer_reviews.author: The Brady Report

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our grandson's birthday gift, and filled it with fishing goodies! It arrived as promised, and was packaged appropriately. Our grandson loved all of the inside compartments - and, even more little compartments for different purposes. We feel it's great for "grown-ups" - so, it should be enjoyed for many years to come! We highly recommend both seller and product.
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what i needed
customer_reviews.text: My Flambeau 5007 Tuff Tainers didnt fit comfortably but I traded those out for some plano two-tier 3600 boxes and those are beyond perfect! I was able to fit in there but its like i have 4 because they're two tiered. I did have to remove the velcro dividers to make it all fit but even then theres still plenty of room including enough for a single level container of the same dimensions to make a stack of 3 containers in total. That's because I haven't even used any other compartment. U still have the front back and 2 sides. overall i love this product.
customer_reviews.author: The MATRIX

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: The top opening where you slide the lure boxes in an out is poorly designed and it is a pain to get the boxes in and out. Also it has a bunch of side pockets put the pockets do not expanded very much which doesn't allow for too much gear. It's OK but not great.
customer_reviews.author: smileyburg

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I ended up buying the Okuma backpack after buying this one and not even using it. It doesn't look like it will last long, I might let my daughter use it instead, because they would charge me almost $10 to ship it back and I'd lose money.
customer_reviews.author: KJSDAD619

customer_reviews.title: Great Tackle Bag
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my wife and I. They have worked out perfect. Be aware you will have to have to spend 15.00 to 20.00 additional dollars for stowaway boxes. You can customize to meet your particular style of fishing needs. We use for bank fishing and fishing out of a canoe. Easy to carry and makes all my fishing toys readily accessible. As always Amazon was the best.
customer_reviews.author: Jlk2

customer_reviews.title: Good basic tackle bag
customer_reviews.text: Well made and roomy enough to take what I need for a day of fishing. It comes with dividers, but I took them out and use Plano 3600 tackle boxes. I can fit 3 easily. Other pockets and pouches hold leader material, teasers, and other stuff I use to tie rigs. It's a little bit asker to manage than the hard-sided tackle box I was using.
customer_reviews.author: A. Maceroli

customer_reviews.title: Solid tackle bag.
customer_reviews.text: The only draw back from this tackle bag are the grips attached to the zippers. They come off with little weight leaving a zipper thats difficult to open until you add your own, which is pretty simple. Many compartments, ample space and rain resistant, light weight too.
customer_reviews.author: a review roller coaster

customer_reviews.title: But I just measured it myself and its actually more like 15 x 9 x 9
customer_reviews.text: This bag is WAY smaller than the dimensions listed. The description has it at 18 x 10 x 14 in, and another one just below that says 13 x 16 x 12 in. But I just measured it myself and its actually more like 15 x 9 x 9. That may not sound a lot smaller, but when you compute the volume, its much smaller -- 2520, 2496, and 1215 cubic inches respectively, so its less than half the size described. Basically, it's a little bigger than an average camera bag....and WAY to small to hold all my gear. Big disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: Sabine Piekarski

customer_reviews.title: I find this bag great. There are bags that are better but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I fish for catfish, so my bag isn't normal. Hooks, pliers, lead weights and such. Along with the odd ball stuff, I find this bag great. There are bags that are better but the prices. Good grief, I can buy several of these. I will be back.
customer_reviews.author: Winston Howard

customer_reviews.title: Zippers are fragile
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag for Christmas last year. Within the first 5 minutes of messing it, one of the zipper pulls came off. I sent it back and got a replacement bag, and I haven't had any trouble with the new one. It's pretty well designed overall. Lots of pockets for storing little odds and ends.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ricks

customer_reviews.title: Good bag.
customer_reviews.text: Great little bag. If it lasts 6 months on the saltwater environment I'll bump it up to 5 stars. Zippers feel a little cheap. Considering getting a couple more so each kind of fishing gets its own bag. Wish they had some more color options.
customer_reviews.author: Bill K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: What can I say about a bag?? I love it. I like the amount of gear I can pack in a quite compact bag. Materials used and workmanship is flawless. I expect this bag to not give out soon. I dragged it around to a hundred fishing holes and it doesnt bother me. That is the best review I could give. Did I mention its only $20 !!??
customer_reviews.author: SkiBum

customer_reviews.title: A steal at this price. Does everything it says ...
customer_reviews.text: A steal at this price. Does everything it says and the receiver of this christmas gift loves it. The base is thick, solid and heavy, adding weight to the whole thing but giving it a lot of durability.
customer_reviews.author: Meeia

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, reasonably priced, and well made
customer_reviews.text: This tackle bag has multiple configuration options, holds a lot of tackle, while maintain a reasonable size. I was able to fit 2 spinner/ buzz bait boxes, three 6 x 10 Plano trays, and 1 small 3 x 7 Plano box in the main compartment. This is a great tackle bag for the money!
customer_reviews.author: buystoomuch

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag
customer_reviews.text: Well I received the bag have not used it yet, but was very happy with it, had lots and lots of compartments to store things and would be handy for any use, would not have to be only for a fishing bag, I really liked the bag and was at a wonderful price, and the quality and construction was very good
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Tackle Bag
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this bag to bring my step father into the 21st century of fishing equipment. This bag and the accessories I purchased with it replaced his 60+ year old tackle box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 13 year old son loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is a different approach to carrying around all of your fishing gear. We were use to the square box. My son loves it and immediately filled it up. You will however need to get some plastic containers to store your items in so they don't move around inside. The price is right and the item is durable.
customer_reviews.author: MJ. Fiore

customer_reviews.title: great for a day on the water
customer_reviews.text: this is a great size bag for a day out on the water. You should be able to fit all your tackle in here w/o any problems. You will need another bag or pack for food and drinks but this is great for tackle. One thing was it shoud have had a suggestion for the plastic trays to buy with it, I got lucky and bought some that fit it nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B.

customer_reviews.title: Good Style & Storage...
customer_reviews.text: I like the style and the storage space of this bag. My only concern is that the zippers appear cheap. My zippers have not broken yet (only used the bag about a dozen times so far) though. The zippers are very small and light weight compared to higher more durable zippers such as those on L.L. Bean products.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great option for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Really happy overall. Great size, comfort, and function for the price. I thin it will hold up well. Plenty of room for my needs. The shoulder strap does twist more than I would like which causes a bit of a hassle at moments.
customer_reviews.author: Justin B.

customer_reviews.title: Structure for fishing is horrible.
customer_reviews.text: This bag is not design for fishing.Takes to long to find what your looking for while fishing. Structure for fishing is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: terry carter

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply Made
customer_reviews.text: If it was built better this would be a great bag, its water proof and has a lot of pockets and dividers. The zipper broke on mine while very gently zipping it closed after only a few uses, and after looking at it, it broke so bad it looks like I was yanking as hard as I could. Get what you pay for I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: It carries a lot of tackle and has nice outside compartments
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift to me. It carries a lot of tackle and has nice outside compartments, The adjustable shoulder strap works great and the hand grab is convenient. Materials are not the best. Second trip to the field and two zippers failed. A for concept, D for putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Scott

customer_reviews.title: I don't see how you can find a better tackle bag at this price point or even double ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't see how you can find a better tackle bag at this price point or even double the price point-- for that matter, it's hard to believe they can turn a profit selling a great bag at this price. It's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: K. Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: love the color combo
customer_reviews.text: use it every fishing trip, and since i live in the north ga mountains i use it damn near every day. had it for two years and still looks brand new. love the color combo... the orange makes it easy to find.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan O'Dell

customer_reviews.title: Great quality product
customer_reviews.text: This bag is bigger than I expected. The image that they have currently doesn't help figure out the size so I have added some images. I would like to see a handle on the top of the bag and not one on each side that has to connect in the middle. Other than that I am very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: B. Spader

customer_reviews.title: The dimensions listed with this product are completely wrong. ...
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions listed with this product are completely wrong... bag is much smaller than dimensions would suggest unless they are using centimeters instead of inches
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Bedy

customer_reviews.title: First soft side tacklebix is great
customer_reviews.text: This is the first soft side tackle box I have owned. I love it. There are many compatments, and the center can be filled with assorted boxes. Definitely a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: minamae

customer_reviews.title: so this soft tackle bag was the ideal gift for her 24th birthday as she can easily pack it on the back of her motorcycle
customer_reviews.text: My granddaughter went fishing for the first time a month ago and found out she loves to fish. She is getting a motorcycle, so this soft tackle bag was the ideal gift for her 24th birthday as she can easily pack it on the back of her motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Sue MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Excelent bag for 20 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Excelent bag for 20 bucks. Be careful if you use around saltwater but that goes for anything. I mainly use as a day bag or fishing from a kayak
customer_reviews.author: Jason Colin Searcy

customer_reviews.title: Super Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I was needing a bag that had some padding for my studio strobe lights. The ones I have are rather long and this bag fits, but its tight, which is a good thing. I was really impressed with the base of the bag. Its reinforced molded plastic. Definitely worth the $20. Actual photo bags I was finding were around $200. Not just for fishing!
customer_reviews.author: BeefSupreme

customer_reviews.title: I wish it had bigger and more pockets and/or better dividers. I'm not sure how water resistant it ...
customer_reviews.text: The dividers for this make no sense, so I just leave them out and stack my plano boxes in there. I wish it had bigger and more pockets and/or better dividers. I'm not sure how water resistant it is but in light rain it did fine.
customer_reviews.author: D. DeBenedictis

customer_reviews.title: Great little bag
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, the picture is a little deceiving as it is a little on the small size but it is not a deal breaker.plenty. of pockets, construction seems to be of decent quality.haven't put it through the fishing season yet so well see if there are any issues but I don't forsee any.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Matson

customer_reviews.title: Extraordinary
customer_reviews.text: This bag is fantastic, it has all the space and storage compartments you can use or think about and then more. Very well made, great materials and ingeniously designed. The rubber protective bottom is an incredible asset. will buy again and recommend.
customer_reviews.author: raul carmona

customer_reviews.title: Useless now
customer_reviews.text: This is not a saltwater fishing bag. Really most bags with zippers don't work very long. I've sprayed this bag with silicone and super protective wax and the zippers are still stuck and then broke. If the zippers weren't a problem it would be a good bag but it is useless now. Sometimes these good prices are too good to be true. Please don't contact me regarding this review you won't change my mind.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Rusty

product_meta.title: Ready 2 Fish Soft Sided Tackle Bag
product_meta.description:
The Ready 2 Fish Soft Sided Tackle Bag is the premier multi-function fishing bag. The new R2F soft-sided tackle bag was designed specifically to work with the Ready 2 Fish tackle boxes and accessories. This bag has multiple storage compartments and tons of extra features. This bag will store and protect your gear no matter where your fishing adventure takes you.

AMAZON.COM
Easily transport your tackle from garage to fishing hole -- while keeping it protected, well organized, and easily accessible -- with the South Bend Ready 2 Fish Tackle Bag. The waterproof bag offers a variety of adjustable compartments, including a dedicated electronics pocket, as well as a cable net to hold a jacket and gloves. 

 Features


 * Waterproof and weather-resistant 
 * Numerous adjustable pockets and compartments 
 * Eight external accessory pockets 
 * Interior map pocket 
 * Insulated strong-box bag 
 * Hook and lure organization 
 * Leak-proof, easy-to-clean interior 
 * Adjustable shoulder strap 

 Specifications


 * Measures 18 by ten by 14 inches (W x H x D) 
 * Fits up to five medium utility boxes 
 * 2.75-pound weight 

 About South Bend 
South Bend Sporting Goods, established in 1906, is dedicated to creating products that allow families to experience the joys of fishing. The company designs and manufactures durable angling products for all ages and skill levels.
feature_bullets: The Ready 2 Fish Soft Sided Tackle Bag is the premier multi-function fishing bag. The new R2F soft-sided tackle bag was designed specifically to work with the Ready 2 Fish tackle boxes and accessories. This bag has multiple storage compartments and tons of extra features. This bag will store and protect your gear no matter where your fishing adventure takes you.
Features a padded, adjustable shoulder strap for extra comfort and convenience while traveling.
The bag has 7 carabiner loops and comes with 2 black carabiners.
Offers 2 Outside Zippered Compartments for maximum storage.
An outside mesh compartment that is easily accessible.
Multiple inner storage compartments that can be used for multiple purposes.
